item.title: New compiling error in adding sprites
item.dc:creator: @Da_0wnz Da 0wnz
item.description:
@Da_0wnz wrote:

ug1yw4t3rm3l0n:

remove the else[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 18, 2009, 02:22:42 pm[/size][hr]and where did u get the donator icon?

Made it myself, got the code from another client.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 18, 2009, 07:39:00 pm[/size][hr][quote=“ug1yw4t3rm3l0n, post:2, topic:295988”]remove the else[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 18, 2009, 02:22:42 pm[/size][hr]and where did u get the donator icon?[/quote]

Btw removed the else and after that I got this error.

Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:324: cannot find symbol symbol : variable image11 location: class Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image11, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441 , anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440); ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
lol

item.title: New compiling error in adding sprites
item.dc:creator: @Da_0wnz Da 0wnz
item.description:
@Da_0wnz wrote:

Ok well I fixed the previous error but now I have this error when I am trying to add a donator icon to my client.

Compiling error:

Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:316: 'else' without 'if' else if (s.startsWith("iconh33")) ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 code:

[code]else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
{
try
{
anInt1440 = 25;
anInt1441 = 16;
Image image1 = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage("./Sprites/donator.png");
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image11, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
}
}[/code]

Lol everytime… Can anyone tell me what I am doing wrong?

Read full topic
